02784 
02785 
02786 #define FABCDHEAT(nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) \
02787     error += (n + s + w + e + frobby); \
02788     result = error >> 2; \
02789     error &= 3; \
02790     frobby = -frobby;
02791 
02792 void CellEngine::n_fabcdheat()
02793 {
02794     QUAD *front = (QUAD *)frontMem;
02795     QUAD *back = (QUAD *)(backMem +
02796                           (backBorder - 1) +
02797                           ((backBorder - 1) * backRowBytes));
02798     long frobby = frob;
02799     long backline = backRowBytes >> 2;
02800     long nextbackline = backline << 1;
02801     long backstride = backline - ((width >> 2) + 1);
02802     long frontstride = (screenRowBytes >> 2) - (width >> 2);
02803     long xsteps = width >> 2;
02804     long yy;
02805 
02806     total = 0;
02807 
02808     // flip frob with the spatio-temporal phase,
02809     // since interlaced checkerboards
02810     // exchange places each step.
02811     if ((phase ^ x ^ y) & 1) {
02812         frobby = -frobby;
02813     }
02814 
02815     for (yy = height;
02816          yy > 0;
02817          back += backstride,
02818          front += frontstride,
02819          yy--) {
02820         register QUAD b1, b2;
02821         register QUAD c1, c2;
02822         register QUAD d1, d2;
02823         long error = 0;
02824         long xx;
02825 
02826         // Flip frob each y line, to apply opposite frobs
02827         // to each spatial phase of the checkerboard.
02828         // This works because the width must be divisible by 4.
02829         frobby = -frobby;
02830 
02831         b2 = back[0];
02832         c2 = back[backline];
02833         d2 = back[nextbackline];
02834         back++;
02835 
02836         for (xx = xsteps;
02837              xx > 0;
02838              xx--) {
02839             long result, cells = 0;
02840 
02841             b1 = b2; b2 = back[0];
02842             c1 = c2; c2 = back[backline];
02843             d1 = d2; d2 = back[nextbackline];
02844             back++;
02845 
02846             FABCDHEAT( BYTE0(b1), BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1),
02847                        BYTE0(c1), BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1),
02848                        BYTE0(d1), BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1) );
02849             SETBYTE0(cells, result);
02850             total += result;
02851 
02852             FABCDHEAT( BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1),
02853                        BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1),
02854                        BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1) );
02855             SETBYTE1(cells, result);
02856             total += result;
02857 
02858             FABCDHEAT( BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2),
02859                        BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2),
02860                        BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2) );
02861             SETBYTE2(cells, result);
02862             total += result;
02863 
02864             FABCDHEAT( BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2), BYTE1(b2),
02865                        BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2), BYTE1(c2),
02866                        BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2), BYTE1(d2) );
02867             SETBYTE3(cells, result);
02868             total += result;
02869 
02870             front++;
02871             *front = cells;
02872         }
02873     }
02874 }
02875 
02876 
02877 #define SUM8R(m, nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) \
02878     (((nw&m) + (n&m) + (ne&m) + (w&m) + (e&m) + (sw&m) + (s&m) + (se&m)))
02879 
02880 #define SUM9R(m, nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) \
02881     (((nw&m) + (n&m) + (ne&m) + (w&m) + (c&m) + (e&m) + (sw&m) + (s&m) + (se&m)))
02882 
02883 #define RISCA(nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) \
02884     result = c & 0xf0; \
02885     switch (result) { \
02886         case 0x00: /* c */ \
02887             result |= (c & 0x0f) ; \
02888             break; \
02889         case 0x10: /* life */ \
02890             sum = (SUM8R(8, nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) >> 3); \
02891             result |= ((c & 0x0e) >> 1) | \
02892                       ((((c & 1) && ((sum == 2) || (sum == 3))) || \
02893                         (sum == 3)) << 3); \
02894             break; \
02895         case 0x20: /* brain */ \
02896             result |= ((c & 0x0e) >> 1) | \
02897                       ((((c & 0x03) == 0) && \
02898                         ((SUM8R(8, nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) >> 3) == 2)) << 3); \
02899             break; \
02900         case 0x30: /* torben */ \
02901             sum = (SUM9R(8, nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) >> 3); \
02902             result |= ((c & 0x0e) >> 1) | \
02903                       (((sum > 6) || (sum == 5) || (sum == 3)) << 3); \
02904             break; \
02905         case 0x40: /* anneal */ \
02906             sum = (SUM9R(8, nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) >> 3); \
02907             result |= ((c & 0x0e) >> 1) | \
02908                       (((sum > 5) || (sum == 4)) << 3); \
02909             break; \
02910         case 0x50: /* ditto */ \
02911             sum = (SUM9R(8, nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) >> 3); \
02912             result |= ((c & 0x0e) >> 1) | \
02913                       ((sum > 5) << 3); \
02914             break; \
02915         case 0x60: /* logic */ \
02916             {   result |= (c & 0x07); \
02917                 switch (c & 0x0f) { \
02918                     case 0x00: /* and */ \
02919                     case 0x08: \
02920                         result |= (nw & w) & 8; \
02921                         break; \
02922                     case 0x01: /* or */ \
02923                     case 0x09: \
02924                         result |= (nw | w) & 8; \
02925                         break; \
02926                     case 0x02: /* xor */ \
02927                     case 0x0a: \
02928                         result |= (nw ^ w) & 8; \
02929                         break; \
02930                     case 0x03: /* nand */ \
02931                     case 0x0b: \
02932                         result |= (~(nw & w)) & 8; \
02933                         break; \
02934                     case 0x04: /* nor */ \
02935                     case 0x0c: \
02936                         result |= (~(nw | w)) & 8; \
02937                         break; \
02938                     case 0x05: /* equiv */ \
02939                     case 0x0d: \
02940                         result |= (~(nw ^ w)) & 8; \
02941                         break; \
02942                     case 0x06: /* flip state 0 */ \
02943                         result |= (nw & 8); \
02944                         break; \
02945                     case 0x0e: /* flop state 1 */ \
02946                         result |= ((~w) & 8); \
02947                         break; \
02948                     case 0x07: /* relay */ \
02949                     case 0x0f: \
02950                         result |= ((w & 8) ? sw : nw) & 8; \
02951                         break; \
02952                 } \
02953             } \
02954             break; \
02955         case 0x70: /* n */ \
02956             result |= (n & 0x0f) ; \
02957             break; \
02958         case 0x80: /* nw */ \
02959             result |= (nw & 0x0f) ; \
02960             break; \
02961         case 0x90: /* w */ \
02962             result |= (w & 0x0f) ; \
02963             break; \
02964         case 0xa0: /* sw */ \
02965             result |= (sw & 0x0f) ; \
02966             break; \
02967         case 0xb0: /* s */ \
02968             result |= (s & 0x0f) ; \
02969             break; \
02970         case 0xc0: /* se */ \
02971             result |= (se & 0x0f) ; \
02972             break; \
02973         case 0xd0: /* e */ \
02974             result |= (e & 0x0f) ; \
02975             break; \
02976         case 0xe0: /* ne */ \
02977             result |= (ne & 0x0f) ; \
02978             break; \
02979         case 0xf0: /* heat */ \
02980             leftover += nw + n + ne + w + e + sw + s + se + frob; \
02981             result |= ((leftover >> 3) & 15); \
02982             leftover &= 7; \
02983             break; \
02984     }
02985 
02986 
02987 void CellEngine::n_risca()
02988 {
02989     QUAD *front = (QUAD *)frontMem;
02990     QUAD *back = (QUAD *)(backMem +
02991                           (backBorder - 1) +
02992                           ((backBorder - 1) * backRowBytes));
02993     long backline = backRowBytes >> 2;
02994     long nextbackline = backline << 1;
02995     long backstride = backline - ((width >> 2) + 1);
02996     long frontstride = (screenRowBytes >> 2) - (width >> 2);
02997     long xsteps = width >> 2;
02998     long yy;
02999     long leftover = 0;
03000 
03001     for (yy = height;
03002          yy > 0;
03003          back += backstride,
03004          front += frontstride,
03005          yy--) {
03006         register QUAD b1, b2;
03007         register QUAD c1, c2;
03008         register QUAD d1, d2;
03009 
03010         b2 = back[0];
03011         c2 = back[backline];
03012         d2 = back[nextbackline];
03013         back++;
03014 
03015         long xx;
03016         for (xx = xsteps;
03017              xx > 0;
03018              xx--) {
03019             long result, sum, cells = 0;
03020 
03021             b1 = b2; b2 = back[0];
03022             c1 = c2; c2 = back[backline];
03023             d1 = d2; d2 = back[nextbackline];
03024             back++;
03025 
03026             RISCA( BYTE0(b1), BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1),
03027                    BYTE0(c1), BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1),
03028                    BYTE0(d1), BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1) );
03029             SETBYTE0(cells, result);
03030 
03031             RISCA( BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1),
03032                    BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1),
03033                    BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1) );
03034             SETBYTE1(cells, result);
03035 
03036             RISCA( BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2),
03037                    BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2),
03038                    BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2) );
03039             SETBYTE2(cells, result);
03040 
03041             RISCA( BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2), BYTE1(b2),
03042                    BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2), BYTE1(c2),
03043                    BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2), BYTE1(d2) );
03044             SETBYTE3(cells, result);
03045 
03046             *front = cells;
03047             front++;
03048         }
03049     }
03050 }
03051 
03052 
03053 void CellEngine::n_insert()
03054 {
03055     long mask = (frob >> 8) & 0xff;
03056     long val = frob & 0xff;
03057 
03058 #define INSERT (Byte)((c & mask) | val)
03059 
03060     CAM_MASKED_REG_LOOP(INSERT)
03061 }
03062 
03063 
03064 void CellEngine::n_heaco()
03065 {
03066     long sum;
03067     long last = 0;
03068 
03069 #define HEACO \
03070     (Byte)( \
03071         (sum = nw + n + ne + w + e + sw + s + se + frob + last), \
03072         (last = sum & 31), \
03073         (sum = (sum >> 3) & (~3)), \
03074         (sum | ((c&1) << 1) | \
03075          (((c&3) == 0) && \
03076           (SUM8REG(1) == 2))))
03077 
03078     CAM_MASKED_REG_LOOP(HEACO)
03079 }
03080 
03081 
03082 // This is a thicker version of dithered heat diffusion,
03083 // that exhibits this wonderful marbling behavior when the
03084 // frob is 1, -1, 2, or -2. It averages the center cell
03085 // with the average of the 8 neighbors, so it's thicker
03086 // than dheat, which does not look at the center cell,
03087 // just the average of the 8 neighbors.
03088 
03089 #define MARBLE(nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) \
03090     error += ((c << 3) + nw + n + ne + w + frob + e + sw + s + se); \
03091     result = error >> 4; \
03092     error &= 0x0f;
03093 
03094 void CellEngine::n_marble()
03095 {
03096     QUAD *front = (QUAD *)frontMem;
03097     QUAD *back = (QUAD *)(backMem +
03098                           (backBorder - 1) +
03099                           ((backBorder - 1) * backRowBytes));
03100     long backline = backRowBytes >> 2;
03101     long backstride = backline - ((width >> 2) + 1);
03102     long frontstride = (screenRowBytes >> 2) - (width >> 2);
03103     long xsteps = width >> 2;
03104     long yy;
03105 
03106     total = 0;
03107 
03108     for (yy = height; yy > 0;
03109          back += backstride,
03110          front += frontstride,
03111          yy--) {
03112         register QUAD b1, b2;
03113         register QUAD c1, c2;
03114         register QUAD d1, d2;
03115         long error = 0;
03116         long xx;
03117 
03118         b2 = back[0];
03119         c2 = back[backline];
03120         d2 = back[backline << 1];
03121         back++;
03122 
03123         for (xx = xsteps;
03124              xx > 0;
03125              xx--) {
03126             long result, cells = 0;
03127 
03128             b1 = b2; b2 = back[0];
03129             c1 = c2; c2 = back[backline];
03130             d1 = d2; d2 = back[backline << 1];
03131             back++;
03132 
03133             MARBLE( BYTE0(b1), BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1),
03134                     BYTE0(c1), BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1),
03135                     BYTE0(d1), BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1) );
03136             total += result;
03137             SETBYTE0(cells, result);
03138 
03139             MARBLE( BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1),
03140                     BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1),
03141                     BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1) );
03142             total += result;
03143             SETBYTE1(cells, result);
03144 
03145             MARBLE( BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2),
03146                     BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2),
03147                     BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2) );
03148             total += result;
03149             SETBYTE2(cells, result);
03150 
03151             MARBLE( BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2), BYTE1(b2),
03152                     BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2), BYTE1(c2),
03153                     BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2), BYTE1(d2) );
03154             total += result;
03155             SETBYTE3(cells, result);
03156 
03157             *front = cells;
03158             front++;
03159         }
03160     }
03161 }
03162 
03163 
03164 // This is the smooth, undithered version of marble.
03165 // It does not exhibit the marbling behavior, which
03166 // seems to be dampened out because of the accuracy
03167 // lost by not dithering the leftover fractional heat.
03168 // It's still interesting as a thick version of the
03169 // smooth angular undithered heat diffusion.
03170 
03171 #define SMARBLE(nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) \
03172     result = ((c << 3) + nw + n + ne + w + frob + e + sw + s + se) >> 4;
03173 
03174 void CellEngine::n_smarble()
03175 {
03176     QUAD *front = (QUAD *)frontMem;
03177     QUAD *back = (QUAD *)(backMem +
03178                           (backBorder - 1) +
03179                           ((backBorder - 1) * backRowBytes));
03180     long backline = backRowBytes >> 2;
03181     long backstride = backline - ((width >> 2) + 1);
03182     long frontstride = (screenRowBytes >> 2) - (width >> 2);
03183     long xsteps = width >> 2;
03184     long yy;
03185 
03186     total = 0;
03187 
03188     for (yy = height;
03189          yy > 0;
03190          back += backstride,
03191          front += frontstride,
03192          yy--) {
03193         register QUAD b1, b2;
03194         register QUAD c1, c2;
03195         register QUAD d1, d2;
03196         long xx;
03197 
03198         b2 = back[0];
03199         c2 = back[backline];
03200         d2 = back[backline << 1];
03201         back++;
03202 
03203         for (xx = xsteps;
03204              xx > 0;
03205              xx--) {
03206             long result, cells = 0;
03207 
03208             b1 = b2; b2 = back[0];
03209             c1 = c2; c2 = back[backline];
03210             d1 = d2; d2 = back[backline << 1];
03211             back++;
03212 
03213             SMARBLE( BYTE0(b1), BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1),
03214                      BYTE0(c1), BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1),
03215                      BYTE0(d1), BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1) );
03216             total += result;
03217             SETBYTE0(cells, result);
03218 
03219             SMARBLE( BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1),
03220                      BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1),
03221                      BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1) );
03222             total += result;
03223             SETBYTE1(cells, result);
03224 
03225             SMARBLE( BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2),
03226                      BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2),
03227                      BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2) );
03228             total += result;
03229             SETBYTE2(cells, result);
03230 
03231             SMARBLE( BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2), BYTE1(b2),
03232                      BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2), BYTE1(c2),
03233                      BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2), BYTE1(d2) );
03234             total += result;
03235             SETBYTE3(cells, result);
03236 
03237             *front = cells;
03238             front++;
03239         }
03240     }
03241 }
03242 
03243 
03244 // This is a flaming version of marble, which diffuses
03245 // heat upward so it looks like a flame. Think of heat
03246 // diffusion as repeated bluring, or an iterative
03247 // convulution kernel. Normally, all the neighbors are
03248 // averaged with equal weights. In this case, we ignore
03249 // the nw, n, and ne neighbors, and look at the sw, s,
03250 // and se neighbors twice, so heat flows to the north.
03251 
03252 #define FARBLE(nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) \
03253     error += ((c << 3) + sw + se + w + frob + e + sw + s + s + se); \
03254     result = error >> 4; \
03255     error &= 0x0f;
03256 
03257 void CellEngine::n_farble()
03258 {
03259     QUAD *front = (QUAD *)frontMem;
03260     QUAD *back = (QUAD *)(backMem +
03261                           (backBorder - 1) +
03262                           ((backBorder - 1) * backRowBytes));
03263     long backline = backRowBytes >> 2;
03264     long backstride = backline - ((width >> 2) + 1);
03265     long frontstride = (screenRowBytes >> 2) - (width >> 2);
03266     long xsteps = width >> 2;
03267     long yy;
03268 
03269     total = 0;
03270 
03271     for (yy = height;
03272          yy > 0;
03273          back += backstride,
03274          front += frontstride,
03275          yy--) {
03276         register QUAD b1, b2;
03277         register QUAD c1, c2;
03278         register QUAD d1, d2;
03279         long error = 0;
03280         long xx;
03281 
03282         b2 = back[0];
03283         c2 = back[backline];
03284         d2 = back[backline << 1];
03285         back++;
03286 
03287         for (xx = xsteps;
03288              xx > 0;
03289              xx--) {
03290             long result, cells = 0;
03291 
03292             b1 = b2; b2 = back[0];
03293             c1 = c2; c2 = back[backline];
03294             d1 = d2; d2 = back[backline << 1];
03295             back++;
03296 
03297             FARBLE( BYTE0(b1), BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1),
03298                     BYTE0(c1), BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1),
03299                     BYTE0(d1), BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1) );
03300             total += result;
03301             SETBYTE0(cells, result);
03302 
03303             FARBLE( BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1),
03304                     BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1),
03305                     BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1) );
03306             total += result;
03307             SETBYTE1(cells, result);
03308 
03309             FARBLE( BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2),
03310                     BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2),
03311                     BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2) );
03312             total += result;
03313             SETBYTE2(cells, result);
03314 
03315             FARBLE( BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2), BYTE1(b2),
03316                     BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2), BYTE1(c2),
03317                     BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2), BYTE1(d2) );
03318             total += result;
03319             SETBYTE3(cells, result);
03320 
03321             *front = cells;
03322             front++;
03323         }
03324     }
03325 }
03326 
03327 
03328 // This is a wavy version of flaming marble.
03329 // We define four different convolution kernels, that diffuse
03330 // the heat in different directions (nw, n, ne, and side to side),
03331 // and select between then based on the phase (0 to 3).
03332 // What defines the phase?
03333 // There are several interesting defintions.
03334 // Generally, we don't want to change phase too often, and we
03335 // want to do it in interesting patterns so the heat flows nicely.
03336 // The right shifting lowers the frequency of the phase changes.
03337 // The anding with 3 is because there are only 4 phases.
03338 // (y >> 2) & 3:
03339 //      Vertically driven phase.
03340 //      Horizontally synchronized vertical waves.
03341 // ((x + y) >> 2) & 3:
03342 //      Vertically and horizontally driven phase.
03343 //      Sheared diamond synchronized waves.
03344 // ((x + y + c) >> 2) & 3:
03345 //      Vertically, horizontally, and smoothly varying
03346 //      temperature driven phase.
03347 //      Diamonds smoothly shifting phase with the heat contours.
03348 //      Interesting feedback driving heat flow direction by heat.
03349 //
03350 // OOPS: There's a bug in the following code that I'm preserving
03351 // since it still looks nice. I meant to type "xx" instead of "x",
03352 // and "yy" instead of "y", because x and y are the position of the
03353 // upper left corner, not the cell. GARBLEBUG is the old buggy one,
03354 // and GARBLE is the fixed version that is described above.
03355 
03356 #define GARBLEBUG(nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) \
03357     switch (((y + x + c) >> 2) & 3) { \
03358     case 0: \
03359         error += (frob + (c << 3) + w + sw + sw + s + s + se + se + e); \
03360         break; \
03361     case 1: \
03362         error += (frob + (c << 3) + w + w + w + sw + sw + s + se + e); \
03363         break; \
03364     case 2: \
03365         error += (frob + (c << 3) + w + w + sw + sw + se + se + e + e); \
03366         break; \
03367     case 3: \
03368         error += (frob + (c << 3) + w + sw + s + se + se + e + e + e); \
03369         break; \
03370     } \
03371     result = error >> 4; \
03372     error &= 0x0f;
03373 
03374 void CellEngine::n_garblebug()
03375 {
03376     QUAD *front = (QUAD *)frontMem;
03377     QUAD *back = (QUAD *)(backMem +
03378                           (backBorder - 1) +
03379                           ((backBorder - 1) * backRowBytes));
03380     long backline = backRowBytes >> 2;
03381     long backstride = backline - ((width >> 2) + 1);
03382     long frontstride = (screenRowBytes >> 2) - (width >> 2);
03383     long xsteps = width >> 2;
03384     long yy;
03385 
03386     total = 0;
03387 
03388     for (yy = height;
03389          yy > 0;
03390          back += backstride,
03391          front += frontstride,
03392          yy--) {
03393         register QUAD b1, b2;
03394         register QUAD c1, c2;
03395         register QUAD d1, d2;
03396         long error = 0;
03397         long xx;
03398 
03399         b2 = back[0];
03400         c2 = back[backline];
03401         d2 = back[backline << 1];
03402         back++;
03403 
03404         for (xx = xsteps;
03405              xx > 0;
03406              xx--) {
03407             long result, cells = 0;
03408 
03409             b1 = b2; b2 = back[0];
03410             c1 = c2; c2 = back[backline];
03411             d1 = d2; d2 = back[backline << 1];
03412             back++;
03413 
03414             GARBLEBUG( BYTE0(b1), BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1),
03415                     BYTE0(c1), BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1),
03416                     BYTE0(d1), BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1) );
03417             total += result;
03418             SETBYTE0(cells, result);
03419 
03420             GARBLEBUG( BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1),
03421                     BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1),
03422                     BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1) );
03423             total += result;
03424             SETBYTE1(cells, result);
03425 
03426             GARBLEBUG( BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2),
03427                     BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2),
03428                     BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2) );
03429             total += result;
03430             SETBYTE2(cells, result);
03431 
03432             GARBLEBUG( BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2), BYTE1(b2),
03433                     BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2), BYTE1(c2),
03434                     BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2), BYTE1(d2) );
03435             total += result;
03436             SETBYTE3(cells, result);
03437 
03438             *front = cells;
03439             front++;
03440         }
03441     }
03442 }
03443 
03444 
03445 #define GARBLE(nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) \
03446     switch (((yy + xx + c) >> 2) & 3) { \
03447     case 0: \
03448         error += (frob + (c << 3) + w + sw + sw + s + s + se + se + e); \
03449         break; \
03450     case 1: \
03451         error += (frob + (c << 3) + w + w + w + sw + sw + s + se + e); \
03452         break; \
03453     case 2: \
03454         error += (frob + (c << 3) + w + w + sw + sw + se + se + e + e); \
03455         break; \
03456     case 3: \
03457         error += (frob + (c << 3) + w + sw + s + se + se + e + e + e); \
03458         break; \
03459     } \
03460     result = error >> 4; \
03461     error &= 0x0f;
03462 
03463 void CellEngine::n_garble()
03464 {
03465     QUAD *front = (QUAD *)frontMem;
03466     QUAD *back = (QUAD *)(backMem +
03467                           (backBorder - 1) +
03468                           ((backBorder - 1) * backRowBytes));
03469     long backline = backRowBytes >> 2;
03470     long backstride = backline - ((width >> 2) + 1);
03471     long frontstride = (screenRowBytes >> 2) - (width >> 2);
03472     long xsteps = width >> 2;
03473     long yy;
03474 
03475     total = 0;
03476 
03477     for (yy = height;
03478          yy > 0;
03479          back += backstride,
03480          front += frontstride,
03481          yy--) {
03482         register QUAD b1, b2;
03483         register QUAD c1, c2;
03484         register QUAD d1, d2;
03485         long error = 0;
03486         long xx;
03487 
03488         b2 = back[0];
03489         c2 = back[backline];
03490         d2 = back[backline << 1];
03491         back++;
03492 
03493         for (xx = xsteps;
03494              xx > 0;
03495              xx--) {
03496             long result, cells = 0;
03497 
03498             b1 = b2; b2 = back[0];
03499             c1 = c2; c2 = back[backline];
03500             d1 = d2; d2 = back[backline << 1];
03501             back++;
03502 
03503             GARBLE( BYTE0(b1), BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1),
03504                     BYTE0(c1), BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1),
03505                     BYTE0(d1), BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1) );
03506             total += result;
03507             SETBYTE0(cells, result);
03508 
03509             GARBLE( BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1),
03510                     BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1),
03511                     BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1) );
03512             total += result;
03513             SETBYTE1(cells, result);
03514 
03515             GARBLE( BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2),
03516                     BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2),
03517                     BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2) );
03518             total += result;
03519             SETBYTE2(cells, result);
03520 
03521             GARBLE( BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2), BYTE1(b2),
03522                     BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2), BYTE1(c2),
03523                     BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2), BYTE1(d2) );
03524             total += result;
03525             SETBYTE3(cells, result);
03526 
03527             *front = cells;
03528             front++;
03529         }
03530     }
03531 }
03532 
03533 
03534 #define TWOHEATS(nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) \
03535     error += ((nw&0x0f) + (n&0x0f) + (ne&0x0f) + (w&0x0f) + (frob&0x0f) + (e&0x0f) + (sw&0x0f) + (s&0x0f) + (se&0x0f)); \
03536     result = (error >> 3) & 0x0f; \
03537     error &= 7; \
03538     error += ((nw>>4) + (n>>4) + (ne>>4) + (w>>4) + ((frob>>1)&0x0f) + (e>>4) + (sw>>4) + (s>>4) + (se>>4)); \
03539     result |= (error<<1) & 0xf0; \
03540     error &= 7;
03541 
03542 void CellEngine::n_twoheats()
03543 {
03544     QUAD *front = (QUAD *)frontMem;
03545     QUAD *back = (QUAD *)(backMem +
03546                           (backBorder - 1) +
03547                           ((backBorder - 1) * backRowBytes));
03548     long backline = backRowBytes >> 2;
03549     long backstride = backline - ((width >> 2) + 1);
03550     long frontstride = (screenRowBytes >> 2) - (width >> 2);
03551     long xsteps = width >> 2;
03552     long yy;
03553 
03554     total = 0;
03555 
03556     for (yy = height;
03557          yy > 0;
03558          back += backstride,
03559          front += frontstride,
03560          yy--) {
03561         register QUAD b1, b2;
03562         register QUAD c1, c2;
03563         register QUAD d1, d2;
03564         long error = 0;
03565         long xx;
03566 
03567         b2 = back[0];
03568         c2 = back[backline];
03569         d2 = back[backline << 1];
03570         back++;
03571 
03572         for (xx = xsteps;
03573              xx > 0;
03574              xx--) {
03575             long result, cells = 0;
03576 
03577             b1 = b2; b2 = back[0];
03578             c1 = c2; c2 = back[backline];
03579             d1 = d2; d2 = back[backline << 1];
03580             back++;
03581 
03582             TWOHEATS( BYTE0(b1), BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1),
03583                       BYTE0(c1), BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1),
03584                       BYTE0(d1), BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1) );
03585             total += result;
03586             SETBYTE0(cells, result);
03587 
03588             TWOHEATS( BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1),
03589                       BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1),
03590                       BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1) );
03591             total += result;
03592             SETBYTE1(cells, result);
03593 
03594             TWOHEATS( BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2),
03595                       BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2),
03596                       BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2) );
03597             total += result;
03598             SETBYTE2(cells, result);
03599 
03600             TWOHEATS( BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2), BYTE1(b2),
03601                       BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2), BYTE1(c2),
03602                       BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2), BYTE1(d2) );
03603             total += result;
03604             SETBYTE3(cells, result);
03605 
03606             *front = cells;
03607             front++;
03608         }
03609     }
03610 }
03611 
03612 
03613 void CellEngine::n_spin()
03614 {
03615     Byte *front = frontMem;
03616     Byte *back = backMem +
03617                  (backBorder - 1) +
03618                  ((backBorder - 1) * backRowBytes);
03619     Byte *f = front;
03620     long xx, yy;
03621 //  float jitter = ((float)1.0 * ((float)Rand8() / (float)255.0));
03622     float jitter = 0.0;
03623     float angle = ((float)8.0 * (float)frob) + jitter;
03624     angle += ((float) hubba) * (float)-0.3;
03625     float rad = (-angle) / (float)(180.0 / 3.14152973);
03626     float dy = (float)sin(rad);
03627     float dx = (float)cos(rad);
03628     float cx = (float)width / (float)2.0;
03629     float cy = (float)height / (float)2.0;
03630 
03631     for (yy = 0;
03632          yy < height;
03633          f += screenRowBytes,
03634          yy++) {
03635         for (xx = 0;
03636              xx < width;
03637              xx++) {
03638             float x1, y1;
03639             long x2, y2;
03640 
03641             x1 = (float)xx - cx;
03642             y1 = (float)yy - cy;
03643 
03644             x2 = (long)floor(1.5 + (x1 * dx) + (y1 * dy) + cx);
03645             y2 = (long)floor(1.5 + (y1 * dx) - (x1 * dy) + cy);
03646 
03647             if ((x2 >= 0) &&
03648                 (x2 < width) &&
03649                 (y2 >= 0) &&
03650                 (y2 < height)) {
03651 
03652                 f[xx] = back[(y2 * backRowBytes) + x2];
03653             }
03654         }
03655     }
03656 }
03657 
03658 
03659 // Driven Diffusion by Two Species
03660 // by Richard J. Gaylord and Kazume Nishidate
03661 // Mathematica in Education Research
03662 // Volume 6, Number 2, Spring 1997
03663 
03664 // 00 000_____ : empty
03665 // 20 001_____ : empty
03666 // 40 010_____ : wall
03667 // 60 011_____ : mirror
03668 // 80 100_____ : A particle
03669 // a0 101_____ : B particle
03670 // c0 110_____ : C particle
03671 // e0 111_____ : D particle
03672 
03673 #define PART_MASK       0xe0
03674 #define ABCD_MASK       0x60
03675 #define PART(x)         ((x) & PART_MASK)
03676 #define ABCD(x)         (((x) & ABCD_MASK) | 0x80)
03677 #define PART_EMPTY      0x00
03678 #define PART_PLASMA     0x20
03679 #define PART_WALL       0x40
03680 #define PART_MIRROR     0x60
03681 #define PART_A          0x80
03682 #define PART_B          0xa0
03683 #define PART_C          0xc0
03684 #define PART_D          0xe0
03685 #define ISPLASMA(x)     (PART(x) == PART_PLASMA)
03686 #define ISWALL(x)       (PART(x) == PART_WALL)
03687 #define ISMIRROR(x)     (PART(x) == PART_MIRROR)
03688 #define ISA(x)          (PART(x) == PART_A)
03689 #define ISB(x)          (PART(x) == PART_B)
03690 #define ISC(x)          (PART(x) == PART_C)
03691 #define ISD(x)          (PART(x) == PART_D)
03692 #define ISABCD(x)       ((x) & 0x80)
03693 //#define ISEMPTY(x)        (((x) & 0xc0) == PART_EMPTY)
03694 #define ISEMPTY(x)      (PART(x) == PART_EMPTY)
03695 
03696 // __XXXX__ : payload
03697 
03698 #define PAYLOAD_MASK    0x1c
03699 #define PAYLOAD(x)      ((x) & PAYLOAD_MASK)
03700 
03701 //  0
03702 // 3 1
03703 //  2
03704 //
03705 // ______00 : north
03706 // ______01 : east
03707 // ______10 : south
03708 // ______11 : west
03709 
03710 #define DIR_MASK        0x03
03711 #define DIR(x)          ((x) & DIR_MASK)
03712 #define DIR_N           0x00
03713 #define DIR_E           0x01
03714 #define DIR_S           0x02
03715 #define DIR_W           0x03
03716 
03717 #define NOTPART_MASK    (PAYLOAD_MASK | DIR_MASK)
03718 #define NOTPART(x)      ((x) & NOTPART_MASK)
03719 
03720 
03721 Byte RandDir(Byte x);
03722 
03723 Byte RandDir(Byte x)
03724 {
03725     long b = Rand8() < 128;
03726     Byte result = 0;
03727 
03728     switch (ABCD(x)) {
03729 
03730     case PART_A:
03731         result = b ? DIR_N : DIR_W;
03732         break;
03733 
03734     case PART_B:
03735         result = b ? DIR_W : DIR_S;
03736         break;
03737 
03738     case PART_C:
03739         result = b ? DIR_S : DIR_E;
03740         break;
03741 
03742     case PART_D:
03743         result = b ? DIR_E : DIR_N;
03744         break;
03745 
03746     }
03747 
03748     return PART(x) | result | PAYLOAD(x);
03749 }
03750 
03751 
03752 void CellEngine::n_driven()
03753 {
03754     Byte *front = frontMem;
03755     Byte *back = backMem +
03756                  backBorder +
03757                  (backBorder * backRowBytes);
03758     Byte *f = front, *b = back;
03759     long xx, yy;
03760     long heat = 0;
03761     Byte     nw,  n, ne;
03762     Byte ww, w,   c,  e, ee;
03763     Byte     sw,  s, se;
03764 
03765     for (yy = 0;
03766          yy < height;
03767          f += screenRowBytes,
03768          b += backRowBytes,
03769          yy++) {
03770 
03771         // .. __ .. .. ..
03772         // __  n ne .. ..
03773         //  w  c  e ee ..
03774         // __  s se .. ..
03775         // .. __ .. .. ..
03776 
03777         n = b[-1 + -backRowBytes];
03778         ne = b[-backRowBytes];
03779         w = b[-2];
03780         c = b[-1];
03781         e = b[0];
03782         ee = b[1];
03783         s = b[-1 + backRowBytes];
03784         se = b[backRowBytes];
03785 
03786         for (xx = 0;
03787              xx < width;
03788              xx++) {
03789             // .. .. NN .. ..
03790             // .. nw  n NE ..
03791             // ww  w  c  e EE
03792             // .. sw  s SE ..
03793             // .. .. SS .. ..
03794 
03795             nw = n;
03796             n = ne;
03797             ne = b[xx + 1 + -backRowBytes];
03798             ww = w;
03799             w = c;
03800             c = e;
03801             e = ee;
03802             ee = b[xx + 2];
03803             sw = s;
03804             s = se;
03805             se = b[xx + 1 + backRowBytes];
03806 
03807             if (ISEMPTY(c)) {
03808 
03809                 switch (((ISABCD(n) && (DIR(n) == DIR_S)) ? 1 : 0) +
03810                         ((ISABCD(e) && (DIR(e) == DIR_W)) ? 2 : 0) +
03811                         ((ISABCD(s) && (DIR(s) == DIR_N)) ? 4 : 0) +
03812                         ((ISABCD(w) && (DIR(w) == DIR_E)) ? 8 : 0)) {
03813 
03814                 case 1:
03815                     f[xx] = RandDir(n);
03816                     break;
03817 
03818                 case 2:
03819                     f[xx] = RandDir(e);
03820                     break;
03821 
03822                 case 4:
03823                     f[xx] = RandDir(s);
03824                     break;
03825 
03826                 case 8:
03827                     f[xx] = RandDir(w);
03828                     break;
03829 
03830                 default:
03831                     // stay the same
03832                     break;
03833 
03834                 }
03835             } else if (ISPLASMA(c)) {
03836                 heat += (Byte)frob;
03837                 heat += ISEMPTY(nw)     ? c : nw;
03838                 heat += ISEMPTY(n)      ? c : n;
03839                 heat += ISEMPTY(ne)     ? c : ne;
03840                 heat += ISEMPTY(w)      ? c : w;
03841                 heat += ISEMPTY(e)      ? c : e;
03842                 heat += ISEMPTY(sw)     ? c : sw;
03843                 heat += ISEMPTY(s)      ? c : s;
03844                 heat += ISEMPTY(se)     ? c : se;
03845                 f[xx] = PART_PLASMA | NOTPART(heat >> 3);
03846                 heat &= 7;
03847             } else if (ISWALL(c)) {
03848                 // stay the same
03849             } else if (ISMIRROR(c)) {
03850                 // stay the same
03851             } else {
03852                 switch (DIR(c)) {
03853 
03854                 case DIR_N:
03855                     {
03856                         Byte nn;
03857 
03858                         if (ISMIRROR(n) || ISPLASMA(n)) {
03859                             f[xx] = RandDir(ABCD(Rand8()) | PAYLOAD(c));
03860 #ifdef DOSOUND
03861                             SoundEvent::Queue(xx, yy, width, height,
03862                                               ((c >> 2) & 0x0f) |
03863                                               ((n & 3) << 4));
03864 #endif
03865                         } else if ((!ISEMPTY(n)) ||
03866                             (ISABCD(nw) && (DIR(nw) == DIR_E)) ||
03867                             (ISABCD(ne) && (DIR(ne) == DIR_W)) ||
03868                             ((nn = b[xx + (-2 * backRowBytes)]),
03869                              (ISABCD(nn) && (DIR(nn) == DIR_S)))) {
03870                             // stay the same
03871                             f[xx] = RandDir(c);
03872                         } else {
03873                             // move north
03874                             f[xx] = PART_EMPTY | PAYLOAD(c) | DIR(c);
03875                         }
03876                         break;
03877                     }
03878 
03879                 case DIR_S:
03880                     {
03881                         Byte ss;
03882 
03883                         if (ISMIRROR(s) || ISPLASMA(s)) {
03884                             f[xx] = RandDir(ABCD(Rand8()) | PAYLOAD(c));
03885 #ifdef DOSOUND
03886                             SoundEvent::Queue(xx, yy, width, height,
03887                                               ((c >> 2) & 0x0f) |
03888                                               ((s & 3) << 4));
03889 #endif
03890                         } else if ((!ISEMPTY(s)) ||
03891                             (ISABCD(sw) && (DIR(sw) == DIR_E)) ||
03892                             (ISABCD(se) && (DIR(se) == DIR_W)) ||
03893                             ((ss = b[xx + (2 * backRowBytes)]),
03894                              (ISABCD(ss) && (DIR(ss) == DIR_N)))) {
03895                             // stay the same
03896                             f[xx] = RandDir(c);
03897                         } else {
03898                             // move south
03899                             f[xx] = PART_EMPTY | PAYLOAD(c) | DIR(c);
03900                         }
03901                         break;
03902                     }
03903 
03904                 case DIR_W:
03905                     {
03906                         if (ISMIRROR(w) || ISPLASMA(w)) {
03907                             f[xx] = RandDir(ABCD(Rand8()) | PAYLOAD(c));
03908 #ifdef DOSOUND
03909                             SoundEvent::Queue(xx, yy, width, height,
03910                                               ((c >> 2) & 0x0f) |
03911                                               ((w & 3) << 4));
03912 #endif
03913                         } else if ((!ISEMPTY(w)) ||
03914                             (ISABCD(ww) && (DIR(ww) == DIR_E)) ||
03915                             (ISABCD(nw) && (DIR(nw) == DIR_S)) ||
03916                             (ISABCD(sw) && (DIR(sw) == DIR_N))) {
03917                             // stay the same
03918                             f[xx] = RandDir(c);
03919                         } else {
03920                             // move west
03921                             f[xx] = PART_EMPTY | PAYLOAD(c) | DIR(c);
03922                         }
03923                         break;
03924                     }
03925 
03926                 case DIR_E:
03927                     {
03928                         if (ISMIRROR(e) || ISPLASMA(e)) {
03929                             f[xx] = RandDir(ABCD(Rand8()) | PAYLOAD(c));
03930 #ifdef DOSOUND
03931                             SoundEvent::Queue(xx, yy, width, height,
03932                                               ((c >> 2) & 0x0f) |
03933                                               ((e & 3) << 4));
03934 #endif
03935                         } else if ((!ISEMPTY(e)) ||
03936                             (ISABCD(ee) && (DIR(ee) == DIR_W)) ||
03937                             (ISABCD(ne) && (DIR(ne) == DIR_S)) ||
03938                             (ISABCD(se) && (DIR(se) == DIR_N))) {
03939                             // stay the same
03940                             f[xx] = RandDir(c);
03941                         } else {
03942                             // move east
03943                             f[xx] = PART_EMPTY | PAYLOAD(c) | DIR(c);
03944                         }
03945                         break;
03946                     }
03947                 }
03948             }
03949         }
03950     }
03951 
03952 #ifdef DOSOUND
03953     SoundEvent::PlayQueue(gui);
03954 #endif
03955 }
03956 
03957 
03959 // daft
03960 
03961 //  0
03962 // 3 1
03963 //  2
03964 
03965 // 00 0000____ : north
03966 // 10 0001____ : east
03967 // 20 0010____ : south
03968 // 30 0011____ : west
03969 // 40 0100____ : north mirror
03970 // 50 0101____ : east mirror
03971 // 60 0110____ : south mirror
03972 // 70 0111____ : west mirror
03973 // 80 1000____ : space
03974 // 90 0001____ : magic
03975 // a0 1010____ : metal
03976 // b0 1011____ : microphone
03977 // c0 1100____ : speaker
03978 // d0 1101____ : input
03979 // e0 1110____ : output
03980 // f0 1111____ : random
03981 
03982 #define OPCODE_MASK         0xf0
03983 #define OPCODE(x)           ((x) & OPCODE_MASK)
03984 
03985 #define OPCODE_NORTH        0x00
03986 #define OPCODE_EAST         0x10
03987 #define OPCODE_SOUTH        0x20
03988 #define OPCODE_WEST         0x30
03989 #define OPCODE_NORTHMIRROR  0x40
03990 #define OPCODE_EASTMIRROR   0x50
03991 #define OPCODE_SOUTHMIRROR  0x60
03992 #define OPCODE_WESTMIRROR   0x70
03993 #define OPCODE_SPACE        0x80
03994 #define OPCODE_MAGIC        0x90
03995 #define OPCODE_METAL        0xa0
03996 #define OPCODE_MICROPHONE   0xb0
03997 #define OPCODE_SPEAKER      0xc0
03998 #define OPCODE_INPUT        0xd0
03999 #define OPCODE_OUTPUT       0xe0
04000 #define OPCODE_RANDOM       0xf0
04001 
04002 #define FLOW_MASK           0x70
04003 #define FLOW(x)             ((x) & FLOW_MASK)
04004 #define FLOW_N              0x00
04005 #define FLOW_E              0x10
04006 #define FLOW_S              0x20
04007 #define FLOW_W              0x30
04008 
04009 #define IS_FLOWING(x)   ((x) < OPCODE_MAGIC)
04010 
04011 #define OPERAND_MASK    0x0f
04012 #define OPERAND(x)      ((x) & OPERAND_MASK)
04013 
04014 void CellEngine::n_daft()
04015 {
04016     Byte *front = frontMem;
04017     Byte *back = backMem +
04018                  backBorder +
04019                  (backBorder * backRowBytes);
04020     Byte *f = front, *b = back;
04021     long xx, yy;
04022 
04023     Byte     nw,  n, ne;
04024     Byte ww, w,   c,  e, ee;
04025     Byte     sw,  s, se;
04026     for (yy = 0;
04027          yy < height;
04028          f += screenRowBytes,
04029          b += backRowBytes,
04030          yy++) {
04031 
04032         // .. __ .. .. ..
04033         // __  n ne .. ..
04034         //  w  c  e ee ..
04035         // __  s se .. ..
04036         // .. __ .. .. ..
04037 
04038         n = b[-1 + -backRowBytes];
04039         ne = b[-backRowBytes];
04040         w = b[-2];
04041         c = b[-1];
04042         e = b[0];
04043         ee = b[1];
04044         s = b[-1 + backRowBytes];
04045         se = b[backRowBytes];
04046 
04047         for (xx = 0;
04048              xx < width;
04049              xx++) {
04050             // .. .. NN .. ..
04051             // .. nw  n NE ..
04052             // ww  w  c  e EE
04053             // .. sw  s SE ..
04054             // .. .. SS .. ..
04055 
04056             nw = n;
04057             n = ne;
04058             ne = b[xx + 1 + -backRowBytes];
04059             ww = w;
04060             w = c;
04061             c = e;
04062             e = ee;
04063             ee = b[xx + 2];
04064             sw = s;
04065             s = se;
04066             se = b[xx + 1 + backRowBytes];
04067 
04068             switch (OPCODE(c)) {
04069             case OPCODE_NORTH:
04070                 break;
04071             case OPCODE_EAST:
04072                 break;
04073             case OPCODE_SOUTH:
04074                 break;
04075             case OPCODE_WEST:
04076                 break;
04077             case OPCODE_NORTHMIRROR:
04078                 break;
04079             case OPCODE_EASTMIRROR:
04080                 break;
04081             case OPCODE_SOUTHMIRROR:
04082                 break;
04083             case OPCODE_WESTMIRROR:
04084                 break;
04085             case OPCODE_SPACE:
04086                 break;
04087             case OPCODE_MAGIC:
04088                 break;
04089             case OPCODE_METAL:
04090                 break;
04091             case OPCODE_MICROPHONE:
04092                 break;
04093             case OPCODE_SPEAKER:
04094                 break;
04095             case OPCODE_INPUT:
04096                 break;
04097             case OPCODE_OUTPUT:
04098                 break;
04099             case OPCODE_RANDOM:
04100                 break;
04101             }
04102         }
04103     }
04104 
04105 #ifdef DOSOUND
04106     SoundEvent::PlayQueue(gui);
04107 #endif
04108 }
04109 
04110 
04111 void CellEngine::n_spinsonly()
04112 {
04113 
04114 #define SPINSONLY ( \
04115     ((((xx + x) ^ (yy + y) ^ phase) & 1) /* spatio-temporal phase */ \
04116         ? c /* stay the same if true */ \
04117         : (((SUM4REG(1) != 2) /* can we not flip? */ \
04118                 ? (c & 1) /* no flip */ \
04119                 : ((c ^ 1) & 1) /* do flip */ \
04120            ) \
04121           ) \
04122     ) \
04123 )
04124 
04125     CAM_MASKED_REG_LOOP(SPINSONLY)
04126 }
04127 
04128 
04129 void CellEngine::n_spinsbank()
04130 {
04131   long bonds;
04132 
04133 #define SPINSBANK ( \
04134     ((((xx + x) ^ (yy + y) ^ phase) & 1) /* spatio-temporal phase */ \
04135         ? c /* stay the same if true */ \
04136         : (((c & 3) ^ /* else xor center with the following */ \
04137             ((bonds = SUM4REG(1)), \
04138              (bonds = ((c & 1) /* if center then subtract from 4 */ \
04139                 ? (4 - bonds) \
04140                 : (bonds))), \
04141              (((bonds == 0) || /* case 0, 4 */ \
04142                (bonds == 4)) \
04143                 ? 0 /* xor with 0 */ \
04144                 : ((bonds == 2) /* case 2 */ \
04145                     ? 1 /* xor with 1 */ \
04146                     : ((bonds == 1) /* case 1 */ \
04147                         ? ((c & 2) /* can we get from bank? */ \
04148                             ? 0 /* xor with 0 */ \
04149                             : 3 /* xor with 3 */ \
04150                           ) \
04151                         : ((c & 2) /* can we put to bank? */ \
04152                             ? 3 /* xor with 3 */ \
04153                             : 0 /* xor with 0 */ \
04154                           ) \
04155                       ) \
04156                   ) \
04157              ) \
04158             ) \
04159            ) \
04160           ) \
04161     ) \
04162 )
04163 
04164     CAM_MASKED_REG_LOOP(SPINSBANK)
04165 }
04166 
04167 
04168 
04169 void CellEngine::n_spinsheat()
04170 {
04171   long bonds;
04172   long heat;
04173   long error = 0;
04174 
04175 #define SPINSHEAT ( \
04176     (error += SUM8REG(0x7f) + frob), \
04177     (error = ((error < 0) \
04178         ? 0 \
04179         : ((error > (0x7f << 3)) \
04180             ? (0x7f << 3) \
04181             : error))), \
04182     (c = (((error >> 3) & 0x7f) | (c & 0x80))), \
04183     (error &= 0x07), \
04184     (unsigned char)((((xx + x) ^ (yy + y) ^ phase) & 1) /* spatio-temporal phase */ \
04185         ? c /* stay the same if true */ \
04186         : ((bonds = (SUM4REG(0x80) >> 7)), \
04187            (bonds = ((c & 0x80) /* if center then subtract from 4 */ \
04188                 ? (4 - bonds) \
04189                 : (bonds))), \
04190            (heat = (c & 0x7f)), \
04191            (((bonds == 0) || /* case 0, 4 */ \
04192              (bonds == 4)) \
04193                 ? c /* xor with 0 */ \
04194                 : ((bonds == 2) /* case 2 */ \
04195                     ? (c ^ 0x80) /* xor with 1 */ \
04196                     : ((bonds == 1) /* case 1 */ \
04197                         ? (((heat >= low) && \
04198                             (heat >= inflation)) /* can we get from bank? */ \
04199                             ? c /* xor with 0 */ \
04200                             : ((c ^ 0x80) - inflation) /* flip and debit */ \
04201                           ) \
04202                         : (((heat <= high) && \
04203                             (heat < 0x80 - inflation)) /* can we put to bank? */ \
04204                             ? ((c ^ 0x80) + inflation) /* flip and credit */ \
04205                             : c /* xor with 0 */ \
04206                           ) \
04207                       ) \
04208                   ) \
04209            ) \
04210           ) \
04211     ) \
04212 )
04213 
04214     CAM_MASKED_REG_LOOP(SPINSHEAT)
04215 }
04216 
04217 
04218 void CellEngine::n_spinglass()
04219 {
04220 
04221 #define SPINGLASS ( \
04222     ((((xx + x) ^ (yy + y) ^ phase) & 1) /* spatio-temporal phase */ \
04223         ? c /* stay the same if true */ \
04224         : (((((((n >> 7) ^ (c >> 0)) & 1) + \
04225               (((w >> 7) ^ (c >> 1)) & 1) + \
04226               (((s >> 7) ^ (s >> 0)) & 1) + \
04227               (((e >> 7) ^ (e >> 1)) & 1)) != 2) \
04228             ? (c & 1) /* stay the same if energy != 2 */ \
04229             : ((c & 1) ^ 0x80) /* flip if energy == 2 */ \
04230            ) \
04231           ) \
04232     ) \
04233 )
04234 
04235     CAM_MASKED_REG_LOOP(SPINGLASS)
04236 }
04237 
04238 
04239 static Byte GlassBondsTable[16] = {
04240     0x00,   // 00 -\ 00
04241             // 00 -/ 00
04242 
04243     0x01,   // 00 -\ 00
04244             // 10 -/ 10
04245 
04246     0x02,   // 10 -\ 10
04247             // 00 -/ 00
04248 
04249     0x0c,   // 10 -\ 01
04250             // 10 -/ 01
04251 
04252     0x04,   // 00 -\ 00
04253             // 01 -/ 01
04254 
04255     0x0a,   // 00 -\ 11
04256             // 11 -/ 00
04257 
04258     0x09,   // 10 -\ 01
04259             // 01 -/ 10
04260 
04261     0x07,   // 10 -\ 10
04262             // 11 -/ 11
04263 
04264     0x08,   // 01 -\ 01
04265             // 00 -/ 00
04266 
04267     0x06,   // 01 -\ 10
04268             // 10 -/ 01
04269 
04270     0x05,   // 11 -\ 00
04271             // 00 -/ 11
04272 
04273     0x0b,   // 11 -\ 11
04274             // 10 -/ 10
04275 
04276     0x03,   // 01 -\ 10
04277             // 01 -/ 10
04278 
04279     0x0d,   // 01 -\ 01
04280             // 11 -/ 11
04281 
04282     0x0e,   // 11 -\ 11
04283             // 01 -/ 01
04284 
04285     0x0f    // 11 -\ 11
04286             // 11 -/ 11
04287 
04288 };
