04290 
04291 void CellEngine::n_glassbonds()
04292 {
04293 
04294     // 0    1    2    3
04295     // c    cw   ccw  opp
04296     // 0x1  0x2  0x4  0x8
04297 
04298 #define MARG \
04299     (phase \
04300         ? (((xx + x) & 1) \
04301             ? (((yy + y) & 1) \
04302                 ? ( /* p1 x1 y1 = c e s se */ \
04303                     ((c & 0x80) >> 7) |  \
04304                     ((e & 0x80) >> 6) | \
04305                     ((s & 0x80) >> 5) | \
04306                     ((se & 0x80) >> 4) \
04307                   ) \
04308                 : ( /* p1 x1 y0 = c n e ne */ \
04309                     ((c & 0x80) >> 7) |  \
04310                     ((n & 0x80) >> 6) | \
04311                     ((e & 0x80)>> 5) | \
04312                     ((ne & 0x80) >> 4) \
04313                   ) \
04314               ) \
04315             : (((yy + y) & 1) \
04316                 ? ( /* p1 x0 y1 = c s w sw */ \
04317                     ((c & 0x80) >> 7) |  \
04318                     ((s & 0x80) >> 6) | \
04319                     ((w & 0x80) >> 5) | \
04320                     ((sw & 0x80) >> 4) \
04321                   ) \
04322                 : ( /* p1 x0 y0 = c w n nw */ \
04323                     ((c & 0x80) >> 7) |  \
04324                     ((w & 0x80) >> 6) | \
04325                     ((n & 0x80) >> 5) | \
04326                     ((nw & 0x80) >> 4) \
04327                   ) \
04328               ) \
04329           ) \
04330         : (((xx + x) & 1) \
04331             ? (((yy + y) & 1) \
04332                 ? ( /* p0 x1 y1 = c w n nw */ \
04333                     ((c & 0x80) >> 7) |  \
04334                     ((w & 0x80) >> 6) | \
04335                     ((n & 0x80) >> 5) | \
04336                     ((nw & 0x80) >> 4) \
04337                   ) \
04338                 : ( /* p0 x1 y0 = c s w sw */ \
04339                     ((c & 0x80) >> 7) |  \
04340                     ((s & 0x80) >> 6) | \
04341                     ((w & 0x80) >> 5) | \
04342                     ((sw & 0x80) >> 4) \
04343                   ) \
04344               ) \
04345             : (((yy + y) & 1) \
04346                 ? ( /* p0 x0 y1 = c n e ne */ \
04347                     ((c & 0x80) >> 7) |  \
04348                     ((n & 0x80) >> 6) | \
04349                     ((e & 0x80) >> 5) | \
04350                     ((ne & 0x80) >> 4) \
04351                   ) \
04352                 : ( /* p0 x0 y0 = c e s se */ \
04353                     ((c & 0x80) >> 7) |  \
04354                     ((e & 0x80) >> 6) | \
04355                     ((s & 0x80) >> 5) | \
04356                     ((se & 0x80) >> 4) \
04357                   ) \
04358               ) \
04359           ) \
04360     )
04361 
04362 #define GLASSBONDS ( \
04363     ((c  /* >> 1*/ ) & 0x7f) | \
04364     ((GlassBondsTable[MARG] & 1) << 7) \
04365 )
04366 
04367     CAM_MASKED_REG_LOOP(GLASSBONDS)
04368 
04369 }
04370 
04371 
04372 // 0    1    2    3
04373 // c    cw   ccw  opp
04374 // 0x1  0x2  0x4  0x8
04375 
04376 // cw opp   2 8
04377 // c  ccw   1 4
04378 
04379 static Byte GlassHeatTable[16] = {
04380 
04381     0x00,   // 00 -\ 00
04382             // 00 -/ 00
04383 
04384     0x03,   // 00 -\ 00   00
04385             // 10 -/ 10 ? 00
04386 
04387     0x00,   // 10 -\ 10
04388             // 00 -/ 00
04389 
04390     0x00,   // 10 -\ 01
04391             // 10 -/ 01
04392 
04393     0x00,   // 00 -\ 00
04394             // 01 -/ 01
04395 
04396     0x00,   // 00 -\ 11
04397             // 11 -/ 00
04398 
04399     0x01,   // 10 -\ 01
04400             // 01 -/ 10
04401 
04402     0x01,   // 10 -\ 10
04403             // 11 -/ 11
04404 
04405     0x00,   // 01 -\ 01
04406             // 00 -/ 00
04407 
04408     0x00,   // 01 -\ 10
04409             // 10 -/ 01
04410 
04411     0x01,   // 11 -\ 00
04412             // 00 -/ 11
04413 
04414     0x01,   // 11 -\ 11
04415             // 10 -/ 10
04416 
04417     0x01,   // 01 -\ 10
04418             // 01 -/ 10
04419 
04420     0x01,   // 01 -\ 01
04421             // 11 -/ 11
04422 
04423     0x02,   // 11 -\ 11   11
04424             // 01 -/ 01 ? 11
04425 
04426     0x01    // 11 -\ 11
04427             // 11 -/ 11
04428 
04429 };
04430 
04431 
04432 void CellEngine::n_glassheat()
04433 {
04434     int code;
04435     int error = 0;
04436 
04437 #define GLASSHEAT ( \
04438     (code = GlassHeatTable[MARG]), \
04439     (error += SUM8REG(0x7f) + frob), \
04440     (error = ((error < 0) \
04441         ? 0 \
04442         : ((error > (0x7f << 3)) \
04443             ? (0x7f << 3) \
04444             : error))), \
04445     ((code == 2) \
04446         ? (((error >= low) && \
04447             (error >= inflation)) /* can we get from bank? */ \
04448             ? (error -= inflation, code ^= 1) /* flip and debit */  \
04449             : 0 \
04450           ) \
04451         : ((code == 3) \
04452             ? (((error <= high) && \
04453                 (error < (0x80 << 3) - inflation)) /* can we put to bank? */ \
04454                 ? (error += inflation, code ^= 1) /* flip and credit */ \
04455                 : 0 \
04456               ) \
04457             : 0 \
04458           ) \
04459     ), \
04460     (code = ((code << 7) & 0x80) | \
04461             ((error >> 3) & 0x7f)), \
04462     (error &= 0x07), \
04463     code \
04464 )
04465 
04466     CAM_MASKED_REG_LOOP(GLASSHEAT)
04467 
04468 }
04469 
04470 
04471 #if 0
04472 
04473 FUNCTION JCRule(Oldstate,NW,N,NE,W,Self,E,SW,S,SE:integer):integer;
04474 CONST
04475      RN=127; L=2; U=2; K=2; Y=2;
04476 VAR     EightSum,NewState:integer;
04477 BEGIN  {Function}
04478     EightSum:=NW+N+NE+E+SE+S+SW+W;     ]
04479     NewState:=0;
04480      IF (OldState=0) AND
04481          (L<=EightSum) AND (EightSum<=U) THEN
04482         NewState:=1;
04483     IF (OldState=1) THEN
04484         IF (K<=EightSum) AND (EightSum<=Y) THEN
04485            NewState:=1
04486         ELSE
04487            NewState:=2;
04488     IF NOT(odd(OldState)) AND
04489        (0<OldState)AND(OldState<2*RN) THEN
04490         NewState:=OldState+2;
04491      JCRule:=NewState
04492 END;  {Function}
04493 
04494 #endif
04495 
04496 
04497 void CellEngine::n_faders()
04498 {
04499   long sum;
04500   long state;
04501 
04502 #define FADERS ( \
04503     (sum = SUM8REG(1)), \
04504     ( ((c == 0) && (sum == 2)) \
04505         ? (state = 1) \
04506         : (state = 0)), \
04507     ( (c == 1) \
04508         ? ((sum == 2) \
04509             ? (state = 1) \
04510             : (state = 2)) \
04511         : 0), \
04512     ( (((c & 1) == 0) && \
04513        (0 < c) && \
04514        (c < (unsigned char)(frob & 0xff))) \
04515         ? (state = c + 2) \
04516         : 0), \
04517     (unsigned char)state)
04518 
04519     CAM_MASKED_REG_LOOP(FADERS)
04520 }
04521 
04522 
04523 // This is a wavy version of flaming marble.
04524 // We define four different convolution kernels, that diffuse
04525 // the heat in different directions (nw, n, ne, and side to side),
04526 // and select between then based on the phase (0 to 3).
04527 // What defines the phase?
04528 // There are several interesting defintions.
04529 // Generally, we don't want to change phase too often, and we
04530 // want to do it in interesting patterns so the heat flows nicely.
04531 // The right shifting lowers the frequency of the phase changes.
04532 // The anding with 3 is because there are only 4 phases.
04533 // (y >> 2) & 3:
04534 //      Vertically driven phase.
04535 //      Horizontally synchronized vertical waves.
04536 // ((x + y) >> 2) & 3:
04537 //      Vertically and horizontally driven phase.
04538 //      Sheared diamond synchronized waves.
04539 // ((x + y + c) >> 2) & 3:
04540 //      Vertically, horizontally, and smoothly varying
04541 //      temperature driven phase.
04542 //      Diamonds smoothly shifting phase with the heat contours.
04543 //      Interesting feedback driving heat flow direction by heat.
04544 
04545 // New interactive harble using joystick hubba.
04546 
04547 #define HARBLE(nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se) \
04548     switch ((((xx - yy) >> 3) + (((xx - yy * 2 - 1) ^ (xx * 2 + yy + 1)) >> 2) + ((c + (hubba >> 4)) >> 2)) & 7) { \
04549     case 0: \
04550         error += (frob + (c << 3) + w + sw + s + s + s + s + se + e); \
04551         break; \
04552     case 1: \
04553         error += (frob + (c << 3) + nw + w + sw + sw + sw + sw + s + se); \
04554         break; \
04555     case 2: \
04556         error += (frob + (c << 3) + n + nw + w + w + w + w + sw + s); \
04557         break; \
04558     case 3: \
04559         error += (frob + (c << 3) + ne + n + nw + nw + nw + nw + w + sw); \
04560         break; \
04561     case 4: \
04562         error += (frob + (c << 3) + e + ne + n + n + n + n + nw + w); \
04563         break; \
04564     case 5: \
04565         error += (frob + (c << 3) + se + e + ne + ne + ne + ne + n + nw); \
04566         break; \
04567     case 6: \
04568         error += (frob + (c << 3) + s + se + e + e + e + e + ne + n); \
04569         break; \
04570     case 7: \
04571         error += (frob + (c << 3) + sw + s + se + se + se + se + e + ne); \
04572         break; \
04573     } \
04574     result = error >> 4; \
04575     error &= 0x0f;
04576 
04577 void CellEngine::n_harble()
04578 {
04579     QUAD *front = (QUAD *)frontMem;
04580     QUAD *back = (QUAD *)(backMem +
04581                           (backBorder - 1) +
04582                           ((backBorder - 1) * backRowBytes));
04583     long backline = backRowBytes >> 2;
04584     long backstride = backline - ((width >> 2) + 1);
04585     long frontstride = (screenRowBytes >> 2) - (width >> 2);
04586     long xsteps = width >> 2;
04587     long yy;
04588 
04589     total = 0;
04590 
04591     for (yy = height;
04592          yy > 0;
04593          back += backstride,
04594          front += frontstride,
04595          yy--) {
04596         register QUAD b1, b2;
04597         register QUAD c1, c2;
04598         register QUAD d1, d2;
04599         long error = 0;
04600         long xx;
04601 
04602         b2 = back[0];
04603         c2 = back[backline];
04604         d2 = back[backline << 1];
04605         back++;
04606 
04607         for (xx = xsteps;
04608              xx > 0;
04609              xx--) {
04610             long result, cells = 0;
04611 
04612             b1 = b2; b2 = back[0];
04613             c1 = c2; c2 = back[backline];
04614             d1 = d2; d2 = back[backline << 1];
04615             back++;
04616 
04617             HARBLE( BYTE0(b1), BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1),
04618                     BYTE0(c1), BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1),
04619                     BYTE0(d1), BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1) );
04620             total += result;
04621             SETBYTE0(cells, result);
04622 
04623             HARBLE( BYTE1(b1), BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1),
04624                     BYTE1(c1), BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1),
04625                     BYTE1(d1), BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1) );
04626             total += result;
04627             SETBYTE1(cells, result);
04628 
04629             HARBLE( BYTE2(b1), BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2),
04630                     BYTE2(c1), BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2),
04631                     BYTE2(d1), BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2) );
04632             total += result;
04633             SETBYTE2(cells, result);
04634 
04635             HARBLE( BYTE3(b1), BYTE0(b2), BYTE1(b2),
04636                     BYTE3(c1), BYTE0(c2), BYTE1(c2),
04637                     BYTE3(d1), BYTE0(d2), BYTE1(d2) );
04638             total += result;
04639             SETBYTE3(cells, result);
04640 
04641             *front = cells;
04642             front++;
04643         }
04644     }
04645 }
04646 
04647 
04648 // From Intel's paper on the Perlin noise function at:
04649 // http://www.pentium.com/drg/mmx/appnotes/proctex.htm
04650 //
04651 // Procedure C_Noise()
04652 // Inputs: u_init, v_init: starting u and v parameters into the image.
04653 //        du, dv: the incremental change to u_init and v_init.
04654 //        ddu, ddv: the incremental change to du and dv.
04655 //        Num_Pix: number of pixels in the scan line to draw.
04656 //        screen_buffer: Pointer to the screen buffer.
04657 // Output: 16 bit pixels are drawn to the screen.
04658 
04659 #define random1(i)  ((i * i) & 65535)        //GREAT! 1 MMX(tm) instr
04660 #define random2(i)  (((i * i) & 65535) >> 2)
04661 
04662 static void C_Noise(
04663     long u_init,
04664     long v_init,
04665     long du,
04666     long dv,
04667     long ddu,
04668     long ddv,
04669     unsigned char *screen_buffer,
04670     unsigned int count)
04671 {
04672   unsigned char color;
04673   unsigned char bx0, bx1, by0, by1;
04674   unsigned char rx0, ry0;
04675 
04676   // Original Perlin's noise program used an array g[512][2].
04677   // This program replaces the array with real-time calculations.
04678   // The results are stored into variables of the form g_b##_#.
04679 
04680   short g_b00_0; // Used to replace array g[b00][0]
04681   short g_b00_1; // Used to replace array g[b00][1]
04682   short g_b01_0; // replaces array g[b01][0]
04683   short g_b01_1; // replaces array g[b01][1]
04684   short g_b10_0; // replaces array g[b10][0]
04685   short g_b10_1; // replaces array g[b10][1]
04686   short g_b11_0; // replaces array g[b11][0]
04687   short g_b11_1; // replaces array g[b11][1]
04688 
04689   // Used to replace array: b00 = p[p[bx0] + by0];
04690   short b00;
04691   short b01;
04692   short b10;
04693   short b11;
04694 
04695   unsigned short i;
04696   unsigned short u_16bit, v_16bit;
04697   signed   short rx1, ry1;
04698   signed   short sx, sy;
04699   signed   long color_p0, color_p1, color_p2, color_p3;
04700   signed   long color_y0, color_y1;
04701 
04702   // Inner loop for the scan line.  "count" pixels will be drawn.
04703   for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
04704     // Convert the u and v parameters from 10.22 to 8.8 format.
04705     u_16bit = (short)(u_init >> 14);
04706     v_16bit = (short)(v_init >> 14);
04707 
04708     // Imagine having a square of the type
04709     //  p0---p1    Where p0 = (bx0, by0)   +----> U
04710     //  |(u,v)|          p1 = (bx1, by0)   |
04711     //  |     |          p2 = (bx0, by1)   |    Coordinate System
04712     //  p2---p3          p3 = (bx1, by1)   V
04713     // The u, v point in 2D texture space is bounded by this rectangle.
04714 
04715     // Goal: determine the color of the points p0, p1, p2, p3.
04716     // Then the color of the point (u, v) will be found by linear interpolation.
04717 
04718     // First step:  Get the 2D coordinates of the points p0, p1, p2, p3.
04719 
04720     // Same as Perlin's original code except floating point
04721     // is converted over to fixed integer.
04722 
04723     // Process the x component.
04724     bx0 = u_16bit >> 8;     // Integer part of u, x component of p0 and p2.
04725     bx1 = bx0 + 1;          // Integer part of u + 1, x component of p1 and p3.
04726 
04727     // Process the y component.
04728     by0 = v_16bit >> 8;     // Integer part of v, y component of p0 and p1.
04729     by1 = by0 + 1;          // Integer part of v + 1, y component of p2 and p3.
04730 
04731     // Next, we need vectors pointing from each point in the square above and
04732     // ending at the (u,v) coordinate located inside the square.
04733     // The vector (rx0, ry0) goes from P0 to the (u,v) coordinate.
04734     // The vector (rx1, ry0) goes from P1 to the (u,v) coordinate.
04735     // The vector (rx0, ry1) goes from P2 to the (u,v) coordinate.
04736     // The vector (rx1, ry1) goes from P3 to the (u,v) coordinate.
04737 
04738     // Process the x component.
04739     rx0 = u_16bit & 255;    // Fractional part of u. (0.0 <= rx0 < 1.0) or (0 <= rx0 < 255) for fixed math.
04740     rx1 = rx0 - 256;        // Fractional part of u + 1. (-1.0 < rx1 <= 0.0) or (-255 < rx1 <= 0) for fixed math.
04741 
04742     // Process the y component.
04743     ry0 = v_16bit & 255;    // Fractional part of v. (0.0 <= ry0 < 1.0) or (0 <= ry0 < 255) for fixed math.
04744     ry1 = ry0 - 256;        // Fractional part of v + 1. (-1.0 < rx1 <= 0.0) or (-255 < rx1 <= 0) for fixed math.
04745 
04746     // Next, calculate the dropoff component about the point p0.
04747 
04748     // Same as Perlin's original code except floating point
04749     // is converted over to fixed integer.  The ">> 1" is used to
04750     // avoid overflow when the values are multiplied together.
04751     // This is not a problem in "C" but will be in the MMX implementation.
04752 
04753     sx = (((rx0 * rx0) >> 1) * ((1536 - (rx0 << 2)))) >> 16;
04754     sy = (((ry0 * ry0) >> 1) * ((1536 - (ry0 << 2)))) >> 16;
04755 
04756     // Now, for each point p0, p1, p2, p3 in the square above, image having
04757     // a unit gradiant vector pointing in any random direction.  This step
04758     // attaches a unit gradiant vector to each point of the square.  This is
04759     // done by precalculating 256, random, uniform, unit vectors.  Then to attach
04760     // the gradiant vector to a point, an index into the array is needed.  The
04761     // index is acquired from the x and y coordinates of the square corner point.
04762     // The algorithm used is called "Folding Over".
04763     // b00, b10, b01, and b11 contain indexes for a gradiant vector for each
04764     // corner of the square shown above.
04765 
04766     // This is where the code differs from Perlins.
04767     // Rather than use arrays p[] and g[][], the values are
04768     // calculated real-time.  Here random1() replaces array p[].
04769     // Perlin's equivalent: b00 = p[p[bx0] + by0];
04770 
04771     b00 = random1((random1(bx0) + by0));
04772     b01 = random1((random1(bx0) + by1));
04773     b10 = random1((random1(bx1) + by0));
04774     b11 = random1((random1(bx1) + by1));
04775 
04776     // Here, random2() replaces array g[][].
04777     // Perlin's equivalent: g_b00_0 = g[b00][0];
04778 
04779     g_b00_0 = (random2(b00) & 511) - 256;
04780     g_b01_0 = (random2(b01) & 511) - 256;
04781     g_b10_0 = (random2(b10) & 511) - 256;
04782     g_b11_0 = (random2(b11) & 511) - 256;
04783 
04784     g_b00_1 = (random2((b00 + 1)) & 511) - 256;
04785     g_b01_1 = (random2((b01 + 1)) & 511) - 256;
04786     g_b10_1 = (random2((b10 + 1)) & 511) - 256;
04787     g_b11_1 = (random2((b11 + 1)) & 511) - 256;
04788 
04789     // Now, for each point in the square shown above, calculate the dot
04790     // product of the gradiant vector and the vector going from each square
04791     // corner point to the (u,v) point inside the square.
04792 
04793     // Same as Perlin's original code.
04794 
04795     color_p0 = rx0 * g_b00_0 + ry0 * g_b00_1;
04796     color_p1 = rx1 * g_b10_0 + ry0 * g_b10_1;
04797     color_p2 = rx0 * g_b01_0 + ry1 * g_b01_1;
04798     color_p3 = rx1 * g_b11_0 + ry1 * g_b11_1;
04799 
04800     // color_p0, color_p1, ... are the colors of the points p0, p1, p2, p3.
04801     // Now use linear interpolation to get the color of the point (sx, sy) inside
04802     // the square.
04803 
04804     // Interpolation along the X axis.
04805 
04806     color_y0 = color_p0 + sx * ((color_p1 - color_p0) >> 8);
04807     color_y1 = color_p2 + sx * ((color_p3 - color_p2) >> 8);
04808 
04809     // Interpolation along the Y axis.
04810     // Output is from -256 to +256, so a 256 color offset is added and
04811     // the final result is divided by 2.  (>>1).  (0 <= next_color < 256).
04812 
04813     // Same as Perlin's original code except the output is
04814     // converted from fixed point to regular integer.  Also
04815     // since the output ranges from -256 to +256, a 256 offest
04816     // is added to make the range from 0 to 511.  This offset
04817     // is the 65536 value.  Then the 0 to 511 is scaled down.
04818     // to a range of 0 to 255.
04819 
04820     color =
04821         (unsigned char)
04822             ((color_y0 +
04823               65536 +
04824               (sy * ((color_y1 - color_y0) >> 8))
04825              ) >> 9);
04826 
04827     *(screen_buffer) = color;
04828 
04829     u_init += du;    // New u for calc the color of the next pixel
04830     v_init += dv;    // New v for calc the color of the next pixel
04831     du += ddu;       // New du for calc the color of the next pixel
04832     dv += ddv;       // New dv for calc the color of the next pixel
04833 
04834     screen_buffer++; // Advance 1 pixel.
04835   } // for x
04836 
04837 } // C_Noise()
04838 
04839 
04840 void CellEngine::n_perlin()
04841 {
04842     unsigned char *front = frontMem;
04843     long yy;
04844     long u = pointax;
04845     long v = pointay;
04846     long du = pointbx * frob;
04847     long dv = pointby * frob;
04848     long ddu = pointcx;
04849     long ddv = pointcy;
04850 
04851     for (yy = 0;
04852          yy < height;
04853          front += screenRowBytes,
04854          yy++) {
04855 
04856         C_Noise(
04857             u,
04858             v,
04859             du,
04860             dv,
04861             ddu,
04862             ddv,
04863             front,
04864             width);
04865 
04866         // Step to the next scan line, by adding du,dv vector rotated 90 degrees to u,v
04867 
04868         u += dv;
04869         v -= du;
04870     } // for yy
04871 }
04872 
04873 
04874 inline unsigned char MARG_RULE_DIFFUSION(
04875     unsigned char c,
04876     unsigned char cw,
04877     unsigned char ccw,
04878     unsigned char opp,
04879     unsigned char r,
04880     unsigned char p)
04881 {
04882     unsigned char result = 0;
04883     unsigned char wall =
04884         (c | cw | ccw | opp) & 2;
04885     if (wall) {
04886         if (c & 3) {
04887             result = 2;
04888         } // if
04889     } else {
04890         result =
04891             (((r & 1) ? cw : ccw) & 1) |
04892             (c & 2);
04893     } // if
04894 
04895     return result;
04896 }
04897 
04898 
04899 unsigned char MARG_RULE_GAS(
04900     unsigned char c,
04901     unsigned char cw,
04902     unsigned char ccw,
04903     unsigned char opp,
04904     unsigned char r,
04905     unsigned char p)
04906 {
04907     unsigned char result = 0;
04908     unsigned char collision =
04909         ((c & 1) == (opp & 1)) &&
04910         ((cw & 1) == (ccw & 1)) &&
04911         ((c & 1) != (cw & 1));
04912     unsigned char frozen =
04913         (c | cw | ccw | opp) & 2;
04914     if (frozen) {
04915         if (c & 3) {
04916             result = 2;
04917         } // if
04918     } else if (collision) {
04919         result = cw;
04920     } else {
04921         result = opp;
04922     } // if
04923 
04924     return result;
04925 }
04926 
04927 
04928 void CellEngine::n_dendrite()
04929 {
04930     Byte *front = frontMem;
04931     unsigned char *nw;
04932     unsigned char *ne;
04933     unsigned char *sw;
04934     unsigned char *se;
04935     unsigned char *data = front;
04936     int xx, yy;
04937     // nw  ne
04938     // sw  se
04939     for (yy = 0; yy < height; yy += 2) {
04940         if (phase == 0) {
04941             nw = data;
04942             ne = nw + 1;
04943             sw = data + screenRowBytes;
04944             se = sw + 1;
04945         } else {
04946             se = data;
04947             sw = se + (width - 1);
04948             ne = data +
04949                  ((yy == 0)
04950                     ? ((height - 1) * screenRowBytes)
04951                     : (-screenRowBytes));
04952             nw = ne + (width - 1);
04953         } // if
04954 
04955         for (xx = 0; xx < width; xx += 2) {
04956             unsigned char nw0 = *nw;
04957             unsigned char ne0 = *ne;
04958             unsigned char sw0 = *sw;
04959             unsigned char se0 = *se;
04960             unsigned char r = (unsigned char)Rand8();
04961 
04962             // nw  ne
04963             // sw  se
04964 
04965             // MARG_RULE(c, cw, ccw, opp, r, phase)
04966 
04967 #if 1
04968             unsigned char collision =
04969                 ((nw0 & 1) == (ne0 & 1)) &&
04970                 ((sw0 & 1) == (se0 & 1)) &&
04971                 ((nw0 & 1) != (sw0 & 1));
04972             unsigned char frozen =
04973                 (nw0 | ne0 | sw0 | se0) & 128;
04974             unsigned char nw1, ne1, sw1, se1;
04975             // nw  ne
04976             // sw  se
04977             if (frozen) {
04978                 int t = ticks >> 4;
04979                 nw1 =
04980                     (nw0 == 0)
04981                         ? 0
04982                         : ((nw0 & 128)
04983                             ? nw0
04984                             : (t | 128));
04985                 ne1 =
04986                     (ne0 == 0)
04987                         ? 0
04988                         : ((ne0 & 128)
04989                             ? ne0
04990                             : (t | 128));
04991                 sw1 =
04992                     (sw0 == 0)
04993                         ? 0
04994                         : ((sw0 & 128)
04995                             ? sw0
04996                             : (t | 128));
04997                 se1 =
04998                     (se0 == 0)
04999                         ? 0
05000                         : ((se0 & 128)
05001                             ? se0
05002                             : (t | 128));
05003 
05004 #if 1
05005                 int count =
05006                     ((nw1 & 128) + (ne1 & 128) +
05007                      (sw1 & 128) + (se1 & 128)) >> 7;
05008 
05009                 if (count > 0) {
05010 //                  static int countHeatMod[5] = { 0, -20, -5, 10, 30 };
05011                     static int countHeatMod[5] = { 0, -1, 0, 0, 0 };
05012                     int avg =
05013                         ((((nw1 & 128) ? (nw1 & 127) : 0) +
05014                           ((ne1 & 128) ? (ne1 & 127) : 0) +
05015                           ((sw1 & 128) ? (sw1 & 127) : 0) +
05016                           ((se1 & 128) ? (se1 & 127) : 0) +
05017 //                        countHeatMod[count] +
05018 //                        frob +
05019                           0) / count) +
05020                          frob +
05021                          countHeatMod[count] +
05022                          0;
05023                     if (nw1 & 128) {
05024                         nw1 = avg | 128; // (((nw1 & 127) + avg) >> 1) | 128;
05025                     } // if
05026                     if (ne1 & 128) {
05027                         ne1 = avg | 128; // (((ne1 & 127) + avg) >> 1) | 128;
05028                     } // if
05029                     if (sw1 & 128) {
05030                         sw1 = avg | 128; // (((sw1 & 127) + avg) >> 1) | 128;
05031                     } // if
05032                     if (se1 & 128) {
05033                         se1 = avg | 128; // (((se1 & 127) + avg) >> 1) | 128;
05034                     } // if
05035                 } // if
05036 #endif
05037 
05038             } else if (collision) {
05039                 if (r & 16) {
05040                     // Rotate clockwise
05041                     nw1 = sw0;
05042                     ne1 = nw0;
05043                     se1 = ne0;
05044                     sw1 = se0;
05045                 } else {
05046                     // Rotate counter-clockwise
05047                     nw1 = ne0;
05048                     ne1 = se0;
05049                     se1 = sw0;
05050                     sw1 = nw0;
05051                 } // if
05052             } else {
05053                 if (r & 7) {
05054                     // Flip opposite
05055                     nw1 = se0;
05056                     ne1 = sw0;
05057                     se1 = nw0;
05058                     sw1 = ne0;
05059                 } else {
05060                     if (r & 16) {
05061                         // Rotate clockwise
05062                         nw1 = sw0;
05063                         ne1 = nw0;
05064                         se1 = ne0;
05065                         sw1 = se0;
05066                     } else {
05067                         // Rotate counter-clockwise
05068                         nw1 = ne0;
05069                         ne1 = se0;
05070                         se1 = sw0;
05071                         sw1 = nw0;
05072                     } // if
05073                 } // if
05074             } // if
05075 #else
05076             // c   cw
05077             // ccw opp
05078             unsigned char nw1 = MARG_RULE_GAS(nw0, ne0, sw0, se0, r, phase);
05079 
05080             // ccw c
05081             // opp cw
05082             unsigned char ne1 = MARG_RULE_GAS(ne0, se0, nw0, sw0, r, phase);
05083 
05084             // opp ccw
05085             // cw  c
05086             unsigned char se1 = MARG_RULE_GAS(se0, sw0, ne0, nw0, r, phase);
05087 
05088             // cw  opp
05089             // c   ccw
05090             unsigned char sw1 = MARG_RULE_GAS(sw0, nw0, se0, ne0, r, phase);
05091 
05092 #endif
05093 
05094 #if 0
05095             int nwgas =  ((nw1 > 0) && (nw1 < 128));
05096             int negas =  ((ne1 > 0) && (ne1 < 128));
05097             int swgas =  ((sw1 > 0) && (sw1 < 128));
05098             int segas =  ((se1 > 0) && (se1 < 128));
05099             int gasses = nwgas + negas + swgas + segas;
05100             if (gasses > 1) {
05101                 int total =
05102                     (nwgas ? nw1 : 0) +
05103                     (negas ? ne1 : 0) +
05104                     (swgas ? sw1 : 0) +
05105                     (segas ? se1 : 0) +
05106                     leftover;
05107                 if ((Rand8() & 15) == 0) {
05108                     total += frob;
05109                 } // if
05110                 int avg =
05111                     (total / gasses) & 127;
05112                 leftover =
05113                     total % gasses;
05114                 while (avg <= 0) avg += 127;
05115                 if (nwgas) nw1 = avg;
05116                 if (negas) ne1 = avg;
05117                 if (swgas) sw1 = avg;
05118                 if (segas) se1 = avg;
05119             } // if
05120 #endif
05121 
05122             *nw = nw1;
05123             *ne = ne1;
05124             *sw = sw1;
05125             *se = se1;
05126 
05127             nw = ne + 1;
05128             sw = se + 1;
05129             ne = ne + 2;
05130             se = se + 2;
05131         } // for xx
05132 
05133         data +=
05134             2 * screenRowBytes;
05135 
05136     } // for yy
05137 }
05138 
05139 
05140 void CellEngine::n_vanneal()
05141 {
05142     long sum;
05143 
05144     if (total < hubba) {
05145         inflation = 1;
05146     } else if (total == hubba) {
05147         inflation = 0;
05148     } else {
05149         inflation = -1;
05150     } // if
05151 
05152     total = 0;
05153 
05154 #define VANNEAL ( \
05155     (((((sum = inflation + SUM9REG(1)) > 5) || (sum == 4))) ? (total++, 1) : 0) | \
05156     ((c&0x7f) << 1))
05157 
05158     CAM_MASKED_REG_LOOP(VANNEAL)
05159 }
05160 
05161 
05162 void CellEngine::n_vanneal8()
05163 {
05164     long sum0;
05165     long sum1;
05166     long sum2;
05167     long sum3;
05168     long sum4;
05169     long sum5;
05170     long sum6;
05171     long sum7;
05172 
05173     if (total < hubba) {
05174         inflation = 1;
05175     } else if (total == hubba) {
05176         inflation = 0;
05177     } else {
05178         inflation = -1;
05179     } // if
05180 
05181     total = 0;
05182 
05183 #define VANNEAL8 ( \
05184     ((((sum0 = inflation + SUM9REG(1)) > 5) || (sum0 == 4)) ? (total++, 1) : 0) | \
05185     ((((sum1 = inflation + (SUM9REG(2) >> 1)) > 5) || (sum1 == 4)) ? (total++, 2) : 0) | \
05186     ((((sum2 = inflation + (SUM9REG(4) >> 2)) > 5) || (sum2 == 4)) ? (total++, 4) : 0) | \
05187     ((((sum3 = inflation + (SUM9REG(8) >> 3)) > 5) || (sum3 == 4)) ? (total++, 8) : 0) | \
05188     ((((sum4 = inflation + (SUM9REG(16) >> 4)) > 5) || (sum4 == 4)) ? (total++, 16) : 0) | \
05189     ((((sum5 = inflation + (SUM9REG(32) >> 5)) > 5) || (sum5 == 4)) ? (total++, 32) : 0) | \
05190     ((((sum6 = inflation + (SUM9REG(64) >> 6)) > 5) || (sum6 == 4)) ? (total++, 64) : 0) | \
05191     ((((sum7 = inflation + (SUM9REG(128) >> 7)) > 5) || (sum7 == 4)) ? (total++, 128) : 0))
05192 
05193     CAM_MASKED_REG_LOOP(VANNEAL8)
05194 }

05197 
05198 void CellEngine::n_freaco()
05199 {
05200     long sum;
05201 
05202 #define FRAIN ( \
05203     (((c & 0x03) == 0) \
05204         ? ((SUM8REG(1) == 2) ? 1 : 0) \
05205         : 0) | \
05206     ((c & 1) ? (0xfe) | \
05207              : (
05208          : 0)
05209     ((sum = c % 0xfe),
05210      (c << 1) & 0xfe)) \
05211 )
05212

05214      ((sum = SUM8REG(1)), \
05215      (((c&1) ? (sum != 5) : (((sum != 5) && (sum != 6)) ? 1 : 0)) | \
05216        ((c&0x7f) << 1))))
05217 
05218 #define FREACO ( \

05228 
05230 // von Neumann 29 state cellular automata
05231 
05232 
05233 enum {
05234   U    = 0x00,
05235 
05236   S    = 0x01,
05237   S0   = 0x02,
05238   S1   = 0x03,
05239   S00  = 0x04,
05240   S01  = 0x05,
05241   S10  = 0x06,
05242   S11  = 0x07,
05243   S000 = 0x08,
05244 
05245   C00  = 0x10,
05246   C10  = 0x11,
05247   C01  = 0x90,
05248   C11  = 0x91,
05249 
05250   OR   = 0x20,
05251   OU   = 0x21,
05252   OL   = 0x22,
05253   OD   = 0x23,
05254 
05255   SR   = 0x40,
05256   SU   = 0x41,
05257   SL   = 0x42,
05258   SD   = 0x43,
05259 
05260   ORX  = 0xa0,
05261   OUX  = 0xa1,
05262   OLX  = 0xa2,
05263   ODX  = 0xa3,
05264 
05265   SRX  = 0xc0,
05266   SUX  = 0xc1,
05267   SLX  = 0xc2,
05268   SDX  = 0xc3,
05269 
05270   DM   = 0x03, // direction mask
05271   RD   = 0x00, // right direction
05272   UD   = 0x01, // up direction
05273   LD   = 0x02, // left direction
05274   DD   = 0x03, // down direction
05275   EX   = 0x80, // excited
05276   NX   = 0x7f, // not excited
05277 
05278 };
05279 
05280 
05281 typedef struct StateInfo {
05282   const char *name;
05283   unsigned char code;
05284 } StateInfo;
05285 
05286 const int JVNSTATES = 29;
05287 StateInfo states[JVNSTATES] = {
05288   { "U",    U     },
05289 
05290   { "S",    S     },
05291   { "S0",   S0    },
05292   { "S1",   S1    },
05293   { "S00",  S00   },
05294   { "S01",  S01   },
05295   { "S10",  S10   },
05296   { "S11",  S11   },
05297   { "S000", S000  },
05298 
05299   { "C00",  C00   },
05300   { "C10",  C10   },
05301   { "C01",  C01   },
05302   { "C11",  C11   },
05303 
05304   { "OR",   OR    },
05305   { "OU",   OU    },
05306   { "OL",   OL    },
05307   { "OD",   OD    },
05308 
05309   { "SR",   SR    },
05310   { "SU",   SU    },
05311   { "SL",   SL    },
05312   { "SD",   SD    },
05313 
05314   { "ORX",  ORX   },
05315   { "OUX",  OUX   },
05316   { "OLX",  OLX   },
05317   { "ODX",  ODX   },
05318 
05319   { "SRX",  SRX   },
05320   { "SUX",  SUX   },
05321   { "SLX",  SLX   },
05322   { "SDX",  SDX   },
05323 };
05324 
05325 
05326 static bool jvnInitialized = false;
05327 const char *codeToName[256];
05328 
05329 
05330 /* Return 1 if pointed by an excited special transmission state,
05331    else returns 0. */
05332 int sp(Byte right, Byte up, Byte left, Byte down)
05333 {
05334     return (
05335       (right == SLX) ||
05336       (up == SDX) ||
05337       (left == SRX) ||
05338       (down == SUX)
05339     );
05340 }
05341 
05342 
05343 /* Return 1 if pointed by an excited ordinary transmission state,
05344    else returns 0. */
05345 int op(Byte right, Byte up, Byte left, Byte down)
05346 {
05347     return (
05348       (right == OLX) ||
05349       (up == ODX) ||
05350       (left == ORX) ||
05351       (down == OUX)
05352     );
05353 }
05354 
05355 
05356 /* Return 1 if pointed by an excited transmission state (ordinary or special),
05357    else returns 0. */
05358 int osp(Byte right, Byte up, Byte left, Byte down)
05359 {
05360     return (
05361       (right == OLX) ||
05362       (right == SLX) ||
05363       (up == ODX) ||
05364       (up == SDX) ||
05365       (left == ORX) ||
05366       (left == SRX) ||
05367       (down == OUX) ||
05368       (down == SUX)
05369     );
05370 }
05371 
05372 
05373 /* Return 1 if well pointed by an excited ordinary transmission state,
05374    else returns 0. */
05375 int wop(Byte state, Byte right, Byte up, Byte left, Byte down)
05376 {
05377     state &= DM;
05378     return (
05379       ((right == OLX) &&
05380        (state != RD)) ||
05381       ((up == ODX) &&
05382        (state != UD)) ||
05383       ((left == ORX) &&
05384        (state != LD)) ||
05385       ((down == OUX) &&
05386        (state != DD))
05387     );
05388 }
05389 
05390 
05391 /* Return 1 if well pointed by an excited special transmission state,
05392    else returns 0. */
05393 int wsp(Byte state, Byte right, Byte up, Byte left, Byte down)
05394 {
05395     state &= DM;
05396     return (
05397       ((right == SLX) &&
05398        (state != RD)) ||
05399       ((up == SDX) &&
05400        (state != UD)) ||
05401       ((left == SRX) &&
05402        (state != LD)) ||
05403       ((down == SUX) &&
05404        (state != DD))
05405     );
05406 }
05407 
05408 
05409 /* Return 1 if well flanked by an excited (not next excited) confluent state,
05410    else returns 0. */
05411 int wce(Byte state, Byte right, Byte up, Byte left, Byte down)
05412 {
05413     state &= DM;
05414     return (
05415       (((right == C10) || (right == C11)) &&
05416        (state != RD)) ||
05417       (((up == C10) || (up == C11)) &&
05418        (state != UD)) ||
05419       (((left == C10) || (left == C11)) &&
05420        (state != LD)) ||
05421       (((down == C10) || (down == C11)) &&
05422        (state != DD))
05423     );
05424 }
05425 
05426 
05427 /* Return excited confluent state. */
05428 Byte cascade(Byte right, Byte up, Byte left, Byte down)
05429 {
05430     return ( ((right == OLX) || (up == ODX) || (left == ORX) || (down == OUX)) &&
05431             !((right == OL) || (up == OD) || (left == OR) || (down == OU)) );
05432 }
05433 
05434 
05435 /* Return excited confluent state. */
05436 Byte excite(Byte state)
05437 {
05438     if ((state == C00) || (state == C10)) {
05439         return C01;
05440     } else {
05441         return C11;
05442     } // if
05443 }
05444 
05445 
05446 /* Return decayed confluent state. */
05447 Byte decay(Byte state)
05448 {
05449     if ((state == C00) || (state == C10)) {
05450         return C00;
05451     } else {
05452         return C10;
05453     } // if
05454 }
05455 
05456 
05457   /*
05458 
05459   Instructions to the construction arm:
05460 
05461     Bits    Construct
05462 
05463     1111    C00
05464 
05465     10000   OR
05466     10001   OU
05467     1001    OL
05468     1010    OD
05469 
05470     1011    SR
05471     1100    SU
05472     1101    SL
05473     1110    SD
05474 
05475   */
05476 
05477 void CellEngine::n_jvn29()
05478 {
05479     if (!jvnInitialized) {
05480         jvnInitialized = true;
05481 
05482         int i;
05483         for (i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
05484             codeToName[i] = NULL;
05485         }
05486         for (i = 0; i < JVNSTATES; i++) {
05487             codeToName[states[i].code] = states[i].name;
05488         }
05489     }
05490 
05491     Byte *front = frontMem;
05492     Byte *back = backMem +
05493                  backBorder +
05494                  (backBorder * backRowBytes);
05495     Byte *f = front, *b = back;
05496     long xx, yy;
05497 
05498     Byte up, down, left, right, state;
05499     for (yy = 0;
05500          yy < height;
05501          f += screenRowBytes,
05502          b += backRowBytes,
05503          yy++) {
05504 
05505         state = b[-1];
05506         right = b[0];
05507 
05508         for (xx = 0;
05509              xx < width;
05510              xx++) {
05511 
05512             up = b[xx + -backRowBytes];
05513             down = b[xx + backRowBytes];
05514             left = state;
05515             state = right;
05516             right = b[xx + 1];
05517 
05518             Byte nextstate = state;
05519 
05520             switch (state) {
05521 
05522 
05523             case U: // unexcited state
05524               {
05525                 if ((right == U) && (up == U) && (left == U) && (down == U)) {
05526                   // no change
05527                 } else if (osp(right, up, left, down)) {
05528                   nextstate = S;
05529                 } else {
05530                   // no change
05531                 } // if
05532                 break;
05533               } // case
05534 
05535             case OR: // ordinary states
05536             case OU:
05537             case OL:
05538             case OD:
05539             case ORX:
05540             case OUX:
05541             case OLX:
05542             case ODX:
05543               {
05544                 if (sp(right, up, left, down)) {
05545                   nextstate = U; // blank
05546                 } else if (wce(state, right, up, left, down) ||
05547                            wop(state, right, up, left, down)) {
05548                   nextstate |= EX; // excited
05549                 } else {
05550                   nextstate &= NX; // not excited
05551                 } // if
05552                 break;
05553               } // case
05554 
05555             case SR: // special states
05556             case SU:
05557             case SL:
05558             case SD:
05559             case SRX:
05560             case SUX:
05561             case SLX:
05562             case SDX:
05563               {
05564                 if (op(right, up, left, down)) {
05565                   nextstate = U; // blank
05566                 } else if (wce(state, right, up, left, down) ||
05567                            wsp(state, right, up, left, down)) {
05568                   nextstate |= EX; // excited
05569                 } else {
05570                   nextstate &= NX; // not excited
05571                 } // if
05572                 break;
05573               } // case
05574 
05575             case C00:
05576             case C10:
05577             case C01:
05578             case C11:
05579               {
05580                 if (sp(right, up, left, down)) {
05581                   nextstate = U; // blank
05582                 } else if (cascade(right, up, left, down)) {
05583                   nextstate = excite(state);
05584                 } else {
05585                   nextstate = decay(state);
05586                 } // if
05587                 break;
05588               } // case
05589 
05590             case S: // sensitized state
05591               {
05592                 if (osp(right, up, left, down)) {
05593                   nextstate = S1;
05594                 } else {
05595                   nextstate = S0;
05596                 } // if
05597                 break;
05598               } // case
05599 
05600             case S0: // sensitized state
05601               {
05602                 if (osp(right, up, left, down)) {
05603                   nextstate = S01;
05604                 } else {
05605                   nextstate = S00;
05606                 } // if
05607                 break;
05608               } // case
05609 
05610             case S1: // sensitized state
05611               {
05612                 if (osp(right, up, left, down)) {
05613                   nextstate = S11;
05614                 } else {
05615                   nextstate = S10;
05616                 } // if
05617                 break;
05618               } // case
05619 
05620             case S00: // sensitized state
05621               {
05622                 if (osp(right, up, left, down)) {
05623                   nextstate = OL;
05624                 } else {
05625                   nextstate = S000;
05626                 } // if
05627                 break;
05628               } // case
05629 
05630             case S01: // sensitized state
05631               {
05632                 if (osp(right, up, left, down)) {
05633                   nextstate = SR;
05634                 } else {
05635                   nextstate = OD;
05636                 } // if
05637                 break;
05638               } // case
05639 
05640             case S10: // sensitized state
05641               {
05642                 if (osp(right, up, left, down)) {
05643                   nextstate = SL;
05644                 } else {
05645                   nextstate = SU;
05646                 } // if
05647                 break;
05648               } // case
05649 
05650             case S11: // sensitized state
05651               {
05652                 if (osp(right, up, left, down)) {
05653                   nextstate = C00;
05654                 } else {
05655                   nextstate = SD;
05656                 } // if
05657                 break;
05658               } // case
05659 
05660             case S000: // sensitized state
05661               {
05662                 if (osp(right, up, left, down)) {
05663                   nextstate = OU;
05664                 } else {
05665                   nextstate = OR;
05666                 } // if
05667                 break;
05668               } // case
05669 
05670             default:
05671               {
05672                 nextstate = U;
05673                 break;
05674               } // case
05675 
05676             } // switch
05677 
05678             f[xx] = nextstate;
05679 
05680         } // for xx
05681     } // for yy
05682 
05683 }
